caption: Exceptional food, nice staff, consistently good ambience. They charge reasonable pricing and the food quality is great. Kudos.

This restaurant is my preferred one. I eat in a lot of restaurants but to this place I go the most. The crew is very amicable and the cooking they serve is so flavorful. I never miss an opportunity to have a nice dinner in this place. I highly recommend this place.
I absolutely liked their food and service, excellent area right next to my apartment. The workers are always kind. Will visit here again.
Excellent food, super nice employees, always  awesome vibes. They charge reasonable prices and the food quality is very good. Keep it up.

I take my family to this great spot many times a year! This is my favorite spot to have a bite.  I go to this spot frequently. The meals are great, the workers are professional and the cost is good. I enjoy eating in this place for a nice meal.
They offer a fantastic range of fresh food. I enjoyed dining here. The employees are always very welcoming, prices are affordable and the place is always well organised.
They serve big portions and for convenient pricing. welcoming owner. Fantastic work.
I like this restaurant a lot. there is a very nice ambiance. The cuisine is great. the service is effective and the stuff is polite. The cost is satisfactory. extremely recommend.

(Translated by Google) The ambience is very nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Only the food (fried chicken breast) did not quite convince. But there is a very good selection of German beers (Pils, Kölsch, light, wheat, ...) and cider.  (Original) Das Ambiente ist sehr schön. Das Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Einzig das Essen (frittierte Hühnerbrust) wusste nicht ganz zu überzeugen. Dafür gibt es aber eine sehr gute Auswahl an deutschen Bieren (Pils, Kölsch, Helles, Weizen,...) und Apfelwein.
It was relaxing and reasonably priced. I would go there again.
Had a very good experience in here with my wife. The food came quick and the service is just great. Prices are reasonable.
This spot never fails to deliver. They serve awesome dishes for fair prices, there are no long waits even when the place is full.
Not the best place in Park Slope , food barely ok , service not good
Very nice place, delicious food, good variety of drinks, good price, friendly stuff. Recommend it!

Place had mosquitos all around,and fruit flies all over the bar. Food took over 45 minutes to come out. Complained to the owner and he said,"You dont even need the food you fat pig" I cant believe this disgusting old man is still in business. A Disgrace to Park Slope.
Good beer selection, nice outdoor spot!
On a weekday was fairly empty which is not necessarily a bad thing. There were good amount of mosquitoes around, so consider getting protected.

Good selection of German Beers kept in good condition. Garden could do with lots of Tender Loving Care (dead tomato plants still in their potting containers?) Shame that the waiting staff were kept waiting for orders at the Bar by using some bizarre system that seemed to micro-manage their service.
Had a very good experience in here with my wife. The food comes out quick and the service is just excellent. Prices are fair.
Great food, very nice staff members, regularly excellent atmosphere. They charge affordable rates and the food quality is good. I recommend this place.

The staff here is amazing. I really had a great time until the owner, who called himself Mr. H, came over to my group and was very aggressive, rude, and disrespectful, as we were closing out our tab. It was completely unexpected and unwarranted. When we told Mr. H that he was rude and disrespectful, he could care less as we had already spent a ton of money at the establishment. Definitely would not recommend this establishment due to the very nasty owner, Mr. H.
Interesting little nook in BK. Never would even guess it's there!
Needs some refresh concept.

The world could be such an easy place to live in. Gose beer from Five Boroughs Brewery in Brooklyn (originally a medieval German top-fermented brew from the Harz mountains, since the 1700s a specialty from Leipzig, Saxony) served in a liter stein in the eclectic garden of the former German Community Center in Grand Prospect Hall, founded 1892 for the immigrants living in what is South Slope today. Add a Knackwurst or Pierogies as the menu is German-Polish and the whole thing is dubbed Brooklyn Bavarian Biergarten (sic!). A true hidden gem in bustling Brooklyn for years and years. I love this place … Dobrze, dobrze!
Beautiful
Great outdoor spot during Spring and Summer.
Decent German beer selection on draft and beautiful beer garden. The interior could use a little updating but overall worth the visit. Great staff as well!
Great  place for all formal  occasions
Awesome place 👍
Fun atmosphere. Great food at fair prices.
Waterfalls, good beer, and lots of outdoor space.
Great pretzel, nice seating in garden setting. Too noisy from.expressway. beer not tapped expertly (no head).
Good venue for events
This place is very family run and casual. Don't go for fast service, but enjoy a leisurely drink!
Really bad experience. Did not get served and told to leave by the owner. Would not recommend.
The food is delicious. The ambiance is odd. Wait staff is very nice. Would recommend.
Great atmosphere and drinks, service not so much. Worth the wait.
Summer place
Disappointed in food & service
Great outdoor seating area. Highly recommend coming on a nice warm day. Get the liter drinks as they are only 4 dollars more than the normal size (7 bucks) and just share it if you can't finish 👍🏼
Close to subway and super cute outdoor seating with some private areas. Wish there were even more beers on tap but overall very good service,  reasonable prices and a great local find.
Good!
Had vegan....burgers... amazing.
Love this place Amazing beer sizes and options.  Great environment,  and they have a horse!
Has potential. Outdoor area is nice, but needs work. Beer selection was nice and food was good. The inside and bathroom situation is lacking. Might not go back until they fix the place up a bit.
Small selection of classic German beers served in large glasses! Bratwurst was a nice compliment to the beer. For faster service I ordered food and drinks at the bar. Look forward to returning.

A vegan option at a German beer gardens is nice. It's an interesting spot with a large garden and trees and a fountain. Unexpected inside quarters. Quite large. Nice for big events, like a high school prom, etc. They were out of several beers when we were there and the nice server clearly knew nothing about beers.

We got there around 8pm, we were seated and within minutes, we were ready to order about $70 of food and drink for 2 people. We sat there for 20 minutes, watched people who we saw walk in after us gets drinks and no one even glanced at us. Nothing. We decided to leave because there are other establishments where we’d rather spend our money. No one even noticed us leaving.

Hi all, I just posted a previous review few minutes ago (see the attachment). I was really impressed how fast the owner saw it and came up to us. The owner explained to the situation he experienced due to changing weather conditions and problem with his staff. He was very polite and respectful. I agree that I didn’t know the situation behind it and was very premature with my conclusions. Paying attention to the explanations and all efforts I’m sincerely apologize fo him and his team, and giving 5* to this place, despite some inconveniences we had. Also, any one has seen owner running between customers helping his staff? I have not. It really impressed me! Thank you, I wish the strongest health and all best wishes to you, your family and your business!  P.S. My personal apologies again  OLD REVIEW  Now I'm at the Brooklyn Bavarian Biergarten right now with my brother, today is May 25, 2018, 7:45pm. Food is great and delicious, beer menu is also great, but there are some problems with service. We ordered Weihenstephan and Hofbrau lager but we were told something wrong with the pump and we can't get it. We ordered Grevensteiner, got the only one and were told they ran out of it. Also after ordering the first beer we were waiting at least 20-30 mins and no any waiter came to us. Moreover we noticed that many people were without any attention waiting to order, some people went by themselves to take the menu because nobody came since they took a table. So I'm giving 5 for food and beer, but for the service and how everything organized. Iguess is the fair grade. If you want to visit this place, food and beer are very good, but be ready to wait wait wait wait... P.S. atmosphere there is very nice and cozy
The place sucks and the people that work there are miserable.  No beer selection.
Good food and good beer in some big steins
Goid beer, good food.  Outdoor area is great.
Very nice atmosphere. Nice backyard outdoor seating. Hope to return there.

I highly recommend this spot for family or group outings. The staff, especially the manager are fantastic and deliver that German efficiency in helping you have a wonderful time here. The food and drinks were excellent and not pricey too. It is also a good place for a date (well not during the cold weather for outdoors) but you get the picture.

It's abhorrent the way they treat people. Check out the reviews for the parent business that shares the building, Grand Prospect Hall. They're not good people and the experiences have been awful.  Was an awful experience. I wouldn't recommend this place. With the food, the staff, and the parking nothing was good. You're better off somewhere else.  We were seated and started talking about the outdoor space with the server, the server told us we should go check out the inside space and told us how to get inside. We're inside looking at the hall and taking some pictures on our cellphone and this women comes out of nowhere and starts yelling at us. There was no in-between, she was nasty from the moment she opened her mouth. I explained that the server told us to come inside, check it out, and take some pictures but she just continued yelling at us. Went back outside to our table the server asked us what we thought and I explained what happened and they were not at all surprised that this woman had gone off. Apparently that's the kind of people they work for.  Save yourself a bad experience, after this I can tell you there's nothing worth having an experience like this. Just truly awful people and unappealing food. You'll see it expressed time and again in other peoples comments here. It's not worth it to put yourself through this.

Only gave it a 3 star rating and this is why: 1. Not really authentic when it comes to the menu, suggestion: maybe adding a German potato salad. It is nr. 1 on all German Biergarten menues. Beer list however has some good beers, but could be more variety. 2. I felt a hint of gentrification, music doesn't fit the atmosphere nothing about that felt authentically german. 3. Very nice setting, outdoors. 4. Cold staff..... that's German, so pretty authentic. 5. I am subject​ matter expert, because I am german.  Prost!😉
Good beer and food
Food was good...great brats.  Plenty of beers.  Cool place to hang with a group of friends
Good food, good beer & good atmosphere. A great little oasis in Brooklyn.
Undiscovered gem in Brooklyn
$10 one litre steins at happy hour! Excellent Uber Pretzels and German cuisine

THIS undiscovered spot is the chillest bar around here. Never have I been disappointed with the food and the beer selection is good. The Dunkel Lager from Munich is my (and the waitress') personal favorite. Cozy outdoor seating surrounded by plant life and running water that makes you forget about the street outside. Caution: Mosquitoes are abundant at times
Nice atmosphere & outdoor seating
Good beer but a slow service
Excellent beer selection and really really nice outdoor seating. Food options look good, will update once I've tried them next time.
Peaceful drinking environment
Great place to hang out and drink German (and other) beer. Truly a garden setting for this beirgarten.

This place is bizarre, starting with the fact that you're greeted by a talking horse statue. (The talking horse, by the way, did not like me very much, but I'm not holding it against the garden.)  There's a waterfall in the back, and tables along a path that winds behind the main hall. The prices here are fair: $12 for a 33 oz stein of beer. Note that the "Uber soft pretzel" does not mean a very soft pretzel, rather, a very large soft pretzel.

Don't tell anyone about this place cause it's about to be my go-to summer spot. Huuuuuge space with authentic German food, VEGAN options and a super chill atmosphere. Y'all been to Munich? This ain't far off...
Unique outside beer garden with good beer, good food (even vegan options), and chill atmosphere.

I live very close so I've been a number of times and always had a good experience. The food is tasty and the beer selection is great. The outdoor area is especially nice but we found the indoor area to be a great option for large groups when the weather isn't so good. We ended up hosting a large group of friends there on a recent Saturday afternoon and they couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating. There was plenty of space for everyone and it was even kid-friendly.
Great experience and service every time I  visit. Very nice location and venue. Highly recommended

Love the vibes of the outdoor section of this beer garden. There are actual trees and plants and so it feels like a garden unlike most other "beer gardens" in NYC.  They sell liter steins of beer and the beer selection is great with local beers as well as German imports.  The food is excellent as well with many German and bar favorites.  Probably my favorite bar in Park Slope.
Great summer outdoor space

Had a large group for a birthday party. The staff totally hooked us up! Food was delicious and was set up nicely for us. We sat there from 3:30 till they closed having friends come and go and it was perfect. Good selection of beers. Definitely will come back. Great place to spend the day!
Great outdoor atmosphere with a nice staff and large beer selection. The scenery was very nice and the background music made the place a nice and quiet place to drink and chat. We'll be back!
amazing place, natalie our waitress was wonderful, manager came over and talked to us, Food was great and the ambience was fun

Disappointing.  Went there for an event, the food (brunch) was terrible and very expensive.  The beer was fine, but a little overpriced.  The outdoor decor was nice, inside was forgettable.  Don't feel any need to go back, unfortunately.
A hidden treasure! Great space, beers and staff.
Great staff and Beers.
Got not the beer i asked for, food overcooked. None of us were blown away.

What a welcome addition to Brooklyn! Adjacent to the Grand Prospect Hall and with shared bathrooms, this is a lovely outdoor space with various levels and types of seatings (picnic tables, high boys, shorter tables) throughout a garden that is shady and cool with a WWII memorial smack dab in the middle of the garden. The space is well-laid out, staff is friendly and I appreciate that they serve brews from local breweries, cocktails and have a decent wine list along with a well-rounded food menu serving Bavarian and American bites.  I tried the wiener (beef and pork sausage) sandwich which comes with fries and sauerkraut. The wiener was delicious complemented by a great bun. The potato pancakes had a good onion to potato ratio, but they were a bit soggier than I like.  BONUS: They accept credit cards!
